page.title: 08EDUCATION-State or Private?
page.content: Under the state schools system children between 5-11 attend the primary school at North Cadbury while those between 12-16 in Woolston and Compton Pauncefoot attend Ansford School,Castle Cary and those in Blackford and Maperton go to King Arthur's School,Wincanton.Those in state education are mainly children of farmers and farm workers.The children of professional people are in general educated privately in nearby schools in Bruton,Sherborne and Sparkford as boarders or as day pupils.Because of the distance involved school transport is provided for all the children of the area attending state schools.As the number of children living in the area drops so the continued existence of the small village primary school is called into question.In 1984 its teaching staff was cut from 4 to 3.
